Brooks–Corey unsaturated hydraulic conductivity K(θ)

Source: R/utils.R
Kfun.Rd

Computes the Brooks–Corey conductivity \(K(\theta)\) with clamping of \(\theta\) to \([\theta_r,\theta_s]\): $$K(\theta) = K_s \left(\frac{\theta - \theta_r}{\theta_s - \theta_r}\right)^{1/\beta}.$$

Usage

Kfun(theta, theta_s, theta_r, beta, Ks)

Arguments

theta

numeric vector; volumetric water content (dimensionless).

theta_s, theta_r

numeric scalars; saturated and residual water contents (–).

beta

numeric scalar; Brooks–Corey shape parameter (\(1/\beta\) is the exponent).

Ks

numeric scalar; saturated conductivity m/day.

Value

numeric vector of conductivities m/day, same length as theta.

Examples

Kfun(
  theta = c(0.10, 0.20, 0.30),
  theta_s = 0.45, theta_r = 0.05, beta = 1 / 8, Ks = 1.0
)
#> [1] 5.960464e-08 3.910661e-04 2.328306e-02
